attributes.comment:
I am a legal immigrant to this country patiently waiting in line for "permanent
resident status" for more than 6 years now. I hold a masters degree in
electrical engineering and have been making valuable contributions to success of
my employer, and well being of the community where I live.

Employment based immigrant is married to the job. That means, no promotion, no
substantial increase in salary. Imagine this for over six year or more. Trying
to balance the family budget and paying more and more fees for "immigration
benefits," is a taxing financially and mentally.

With Visa dates for adjustments of status set in stone age for people born in
India and such fee hikes on top of that will cause people like me to eventually
lose patience and may return to India.

I don't understand how it is in American interest to let people like me, who are
highly educated, with years of experience in high-technology industry, to leave
US carrying the skills, experience, and money earned here.

I STRONGLY OPPOSE this fee increase.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
